cont.entity_a: Works well with laptops from 2005 onwards. Works well with older Mac laptops using WPA Personal.
cont.entity_b: Good performer for Linux-based laptops. Works well with older laptops for basic wireless needs.

cont.entity_a: Achieves speeds of 54 MbS in the same room and 48 MbS two rooms away. Speed decreases significantly over 100 feet with obstructing walls. Solid connections and decent speeds for a Wireless G card.
Installation requires only installing the driver. Easy to install, software allows reverting to Windows Wireless management. Installation process is simple with a quick setup.
cont.entity_b: Installation can be challenging on older laptops. Installation is generally easy, but setup issues can occur.

cont.entity_a: Signal strength is inconsistent. Strong signals compared to 802.11b cards.
cont.entity_b: Signal drops significantly beyond 30-40 feet. Signal reception is good throughout a two-story house.

cont.entity_a: Works with Linux and is reliable. Linksys customer service is reliable.
cont.entity_b: Quick delivery and works as expected. Warranty and support may be void due to the product's age.

cont.entity_a: Some compatibility issues with Cisco encryption. Not suitable for secure, modern routers.
cont.entity_b: Supports WPA & WEP with stable connections over long distances. Basic connectivity works on Windows 98. Does not work with secure modern routers.

cont.entity_a: Linksys installation directions may cause conflicts with XP.
cont.entity_b: Linksys support site provides necessary drivers.

cont.entity_a: The card can be fragile if not handled carefully.

cont.entity_b: Good connection within the house but limited range.

cont.entity_a: Outdated for modern laptops with built-in wireless.

cont.entity_b: 2 GB hard drive not sufficient for Windows 10 updates.
